body: I recall a few bug fixes that went in around the revision flag in the past few releases - are you able to reproduce with latest 1.19.3 version?

@GregHanson thank you for replying! Is there a patch version on 1.18 that also includes the fixes? I'm running in a controlled environment and upgrading minor version may cause some compatibility issue

I think this is basically as simple as making https://github.com/istio/istio/blob/da4c765c0f292d7840e01b16305990d5d941bd1a/manifests/charts/istiod-remote/templates/services.yaml#L10 support the revision suffix. Though you need your VirtualService to match on the specific SNI and route to the correct backend instead of the current `*` match
expose-istiod-rev.yaml.tmpl sample shows the VS needed

To close the loop for anyone coming across the issue. What we ended up doing is 
1. Configure the VS as
```
...
spec:
  ...
  hosts:
  - istiod-{revision}.{ns}.svc
  tls:
  - match:
    - port: 15012
       sniHosts:
       - istiod-{revision}.{ns}.{k8s service dns suffix}
    - port: 15017
       {same as above}
```
2. When installing remote cluster, add `revision: {revision}` to the `IstioOperator` then `-{revision}` to the `Istiod` service like what's pointed out above.

issue.title: fix: revision value should be respected for remote cluster svc/endpoint
